toyotama.pwn package¶

Submodules¶

toyotama.pwn.fsa module¶

toyotama.pwn.fsa.fsa_write(target_addr: int, values: int, nth_stack: int, output=0, sofar=0, offset=0, bits=64)¶

Arbitrary write using format string bug

Parameters

  • target_addr (int) – The address where the content will be written.

  • values (int) – The values to write.

  • nth_stack (int) – example “AAAA%p %p %p…” -> AAAA0x1e 0xf7f6f580 0x804860b 0xf7f6f000 0xf7fbb2f0 (nil) 0x4141d402 -> 7th (0x4141d402)

  • output (int, optional) – The number of characters which executable output.

  • sofar (int, optional) – The length of payload so far.

  • offset (int, optional) – From nth_stack’s example, offset is 2 (0x4141d402).

  • bits (int, optional) – The bits of the target binary.

Returns

The payload

Return type

bytes

toyotama.pwn.util module¶

toyotama.pwn.util.fill(length: int, character: AnyStr = b'A') → AnyStr¶

Generate b”AAA…” padding

Parameters

  • length (int) – The length of padding.

  • character (str or bytes, optional) – The character to fill.

Returns

The string by repeating character for length times

Return type

str or bytes
